title: Woman's Long Pao (Formal Domestic Robe)

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of silk and gold-leaf-over-lacquered-paper-strip-wrapped silk, slit tapestry weave with interlaced outlining wefts; painted details; trimmed with braid of gilt-metal-strip-wrapped silk, 2:2 twill oblique interlacing; edging and closures: silk and gold-leaf-over-lacquered-paper-strip-wrapped silk, warp-float faced 7:1 satin weave with plain interlacings of secondary binding warps and supplementary patterning wefts; body lined with silk, 4:1 satin damask weave; sleeves lined with silk, warp-float faced 7:1 satin weave.

medium_display: Silk and gold-leaf-over-lacquered-paper-strip-wrapped silk, slit tapestry weave with interlaced outlining wefts; painted details; trimmed with braid of gilt-metal-strip-wrapped silk, 2:2 twill oblique interlacing; edging and closures: silk and gold-leaf-over-lacquered-paper-strip-wrapped silk, warp-float faced 7:1 satin weave with plain interlacings of secondary binding warps and supplementary patterning wefts; body lined with silk, 4:1 satin damask weave; sleeves lined with silk, warp-float faced 7:1 satin weave
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. John J. Abbott
publication_history: John E. Vollmer, "Clothed to Rule the Universe: Ming and Qing Dynasty Textiles at The Art Institute of Chicago," published in conjunction with the exhibition, Art Institute of Chicago Museum Studies 26, no. 2 (2000): 48, 72, 91, cat.  57, plate XXXI.
exhibition_history:
Art Institute of Chicago, Chinese Costumes and Accessories, Oct. 20, 1945–June 30, 1946.

Art Institute of Chicago, Elizabeth F. Cheney and Agnes Allerton Textile Galleries, Clothed to Rule the Universe: Ming and Qing Dynasty Textiles at The Art Institute of Chicago, Sept. 13, 2000–Jan. 2, 2001.

Art Institute of Chicago, Asian Art Rotation, Gallery 108, Sept. 25, 2001-Mar. 12, 2002.

Art Institute of Chicago, Asian Art Rotation, Gallery 108, June 24-Dec. 7, 2005.
provenance_text: Mrs. John J. Abbott, Chicago, by 1943 [Incoming permanent receipt R7918, Mar. 15, 1943; copy in curatorial object file]; given to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1943.
